title: Drawing, "Design for a Painted Porcelain Soup Plate", 1787–1800
medium: Brush and watercolor, black chalk on cream laid paper
markings: Watermark:  J. HONIG & ZOONEN (Heawood 3345); Stamp:  Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration in brown, lower center verso:  Lugt 457e
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, lower center:  N .6 altro tondino più picolo con maggier concavità; in graphite, lower left corner verso, sideways:  P.18
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: View of plate in plan (above) and in elevation (below).  Above, soup late with slightly scalloped rim decorated in fishscale pattern in gold, with a large floral spray of yellow rose and blue tulip? in middle.  Below, undecorated  lower rim edged in gold and base.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Painted Porcelain Soup Plate", 1787–1800.
1787–1800. Brush and watercolor, black chalk on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2592.
